intro: Hemizonia macradenia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Hemizonia macradenia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
